name: David Rupper
bio:
David retired from a global insurance company as a corporate ethics and compliance vice-president in May 2019. Although David had extensive corporate experience in Asia (including living in Hong Kong and Tokyo), he focused his retirement efforts on non-profit work in Africa. David has volunteered as a career and economic development specialist for BYU-Pathway Worldwide in Africa. He also assisted with the organization of The Lord's Hands (where he acts as an advisor). 

David currently sits on the Global Board of the BYU Management Society where he serves a VP, Strategic Development with a concentration of Africa.

name: Joseph Bentum
bio:
Joseph Bentum's journey is truly inspiring. Growing up in Ghana, he faced the challenges that life presented in his community, but rather than being deterred, he embraced them as opportunities for positive change. His passion for transforming communities and empowering individuals was sparked in this environment.Joseph's local insights and unwavering commitment have played a pivotal role in driving Inclusion Afrika's mission to uplift African youth and create pathways to self-reliance. 

His story is a testament to the idea that transformative change often begins with the determination of one person. Joseph serves as a guiding force in Inclusion Afrika's journey of inclusivity and empowerment, inspiring others to believe in the power of resilience and the potential for positive change.
